Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tdr1976
Reviews.Content: Service in this hotel is excellent with very attentive staff. Clean and very nice rooms in a very nice location of Berlin. I recommend this hotel. I was there for a trade show and will surely be there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: pallinime
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on Kurfurstendamm. Good service and friendly staff. Very big and comfort rooms with king-size bed (comfort double rooms). There's small kitchen in room #205. The best hotel for this price. Free bathrobe (ask at reception). Free Wi-fi in the room (ask login also at reception).

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable value option near Kurfuerstendamm”
Reviews.Author: mjb1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights - about 20-30 metres from the Kurfuerstendamm, and also from Uhlandstrasse U-bahn. The staff are efficient, rooms are quite large, clean and comfortable (I slept very well), there is free WiFi (but you may have to pop down to reception to get a signal) and rooms also have a safe for the laptop. What's not to like..? Well, not only the rooms, but... it's often excellent value, even compared to other Berlin hotel prices that are modest compared to many other places in Europe. Always on my shortlist if I'm visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MPM5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over New Years eve. Having read many fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor I have to admit that my first reaction upon checking in to the hotel was one of disappointment. The professional photos of the hotel are very flattering. The staff on check-in were very efficient but not overly friendly. The room that we were allocated was a good size but was quite dated and stank of cigarettes. The bathroom was one of the biggest hotel bathrooms I've ever seen. Both the room and the bathroom were very clean. Having got over the initial disappointment that the room was not quite as modern as we expected, we discovered that its saving grace was its location. Hecker's is the perfect location for exploring Berlin and while it is located in a very busy area it is extremely quiet. We had 3 days of exploring the city and 3 nights where we didn't hear a peep from anyone in the corridors or outside the hotel. This is the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel is within walking distance of some great restaurants and is close to both the tube and the overground train station. I would return to this hotel again for two reasons - it is wonderfully quiet which means you get a fantastic sleep and it is in the perfect location for exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: somersetphysicist
Reviews.Content: Large and well equiped room -with little kitcchen off. Although the hotel is in a busy part of town the room was quiet and restful. We had a special deal of 3 for 2 nights. very good value compared to most European capitals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: GasheadBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a short break. Hotel very convenient for all facilities and a 10 minute walk from the Christmas Market near the Zoological Garten railway station. Good size room, very comfortable bed, great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Just an "Excellent" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelSens
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very central location and walking distance to shopping district. The rooms are very specious and welcoming. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The furniture in the room is out dated and shows signs of tear. If you are visiting during summer, you should watch out, as there is no AC unit in the room. The internet connection is very slow and sometimes you might have difficulty to download large files or your connection might fail. The hotel staffs are very friendly and hospitable. The Breakfast buffet was very well supplied with selection of cold cuts, variety of cheeses, freshly squeezed juice, pancakes, bacon, eggs, plus a huge selection of cereals, breads, yoghurts and jams. Overall, you do not need to book an expensive hotel and I really had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian4886
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, good facilities, helpful staff, great breakfast and next to lots of options for public transport (get a Berlin Welcome Card which gives you unlimited travel for the number of days you need). If you land at Tegel airport get the 109 bus from the terminal to a stop close to the hotel in Kurfürstendamm rather than going on the underground. That way you have no changing of lines dragging your suitcase up and down stairs. Order the Berlin Welcome Card beforehand and you can use it on this first trip. Activate it on the bus - we got a five day card and used it every day.

Reviews.Title: “DANGEROUS WIRING-SERIOUS HEALTH & SAFETY ISSUES”
Reviews.Author: Lynher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hecker Hotel whilst were In Berlin for a city break during the August bank holiday this year. I booked this hotel through Airmiles after reading the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. It was all that was claimed however, lack of coffee/tea making facilities and lack of air-conditioning was a definite downside. At the end of the stay just as we were about to check out I noticed what seemed to be some very serious and dangerous health & safety issue. This was an electrical connection of a free standing corner uplighter with a dimmer switch attached to a socket through what looked like live wires (photos attached). If, what I suspect is true, then this is a serious matter, not something I expect to see in one of the most technologically advanced nation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: richardLeedsUK
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned that this hotel might be a long way from where we wanted to visit, but the position is perfect - on an attractive leafy street midway between an underground and an overground station and five minutes' walk from the Ku'damm. (Don't waste money on a taxi if arriving at the Hauptbahnhof - the journey of 3/4 stops takes nine minutes and costs 2.40 Euros). Some lovely restaurants very close by. I also feared Heckers might be very corporate, but it didn't feel like that - pleasant reception area and good service, nice light wide corridors and a very big room with large comfortable beds (push together for a double), a nice dressing area and spotless bathroom. Decor wasn't cutting edge, but pleasant and in excellent condition. We had a room on the road side but there was no traffic noise at all and in fact very little traffic anyway. We didn't investigate the gym. Helpful receptionist printed off train times for us. My only negatives are that I would have hoped for thicker and larger towels for the price and for tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We didn't try the breakfast as we went each morning to the lovely organic supermarket across the road, where you can sit and have fresh coffee and croissants for 2/3 Euros. I'd recommend this hotel unless you want somewhere very funky or very corporate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - love to come back again”
Reviews.Author: Memphis2000
Reviews.Content: Nice location - just a few steps from all the Berlin's attractions. Spacious and comfortable rooms. Huge&tasty breakfast. Very friendly personnel. Affordable price. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Would Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located in Charlottesburg, sp? in Berlin. It is walking distance from the zoo, subway station, many restaurants, coffee shops, etc. The staff was kind and spoke very good English. The breakfast buffet was delicious. It offered rolls, muffins, croissants, jellies, butter, sliced meats and cheeses, cereal, yogurt, bacon, eggs (boiled and scrambled), sausages, fresh fruit salad, juice, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Our room was clean and spacious with a very nice bathroom. The area was quiet around the neighborhood and we kept our windows open all night with no noise issues. Self parking is directly behind the hotel and was easy to access and you could see your vehicle from the hotel. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and the price. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel that we would reccomend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: benno494
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hecker's Hotel for four days in August 2011. We found the Hotel staff to be helpful and pleasant from the moment we arrived. We had been offered a room at the back of the Hotel and when we asked for a view of the street (Grolmanstrasse) the Receptionist immedietly upgraded our room, at no extra cost, so that we could have the view we wanted. This helpful and pleasant attitude was not limited to the Reception and all our dealings with the staff made us feel like welcome guests. Our room was large with a very comfortable double bed, a dressing room and a good bathroom. The TV was a large Plasma TV which had a good range of programmes (mostly in German) and a quality radio was also provided. The entire hotel was spotlessly clean and well maintained. The breakfast was very good and in a beautiful dinning room ( Art Deco) at the entrance to the Hotel. The Hotel location was perfect for a visit to Berlin. Grolmanstrasse is off the Kurfurstendamm in the fashionable Charlottenburg area and moments away from Savignyplaz which is a really trendy square full of resteraunts, bars, art and book shops - and with a train station that will take you straight to the centre of Berlin. My wife and I want to reccomend this Hotel to you - its first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: divecario
Reviews.Content: Heckers was incredibly convenient for public transport (bus 109 from airport), the staff were friendly and efficient - birthday and anniversary weekend, so we received a room upgrade and bottle of bubbly in room. The room was very spacious indeed, scrupulously clean and the bathroom likewise. Well stocked mini bar, room safe and walk in wardrobe. The restaurant attached to the hotel may not be the cheapest, but it's not outrageous and because the food is SO good, it does give good value for money. Breakfast was just the right mix and variety with loads of healthy options alongside the traditional German, continental and cooked breakfasts and, my favourite, a pile of oranges and electric juicer - can't get fresher than that. Highly recommend! Also recommend the city sightseeing bus if you're only there for short while but want to see everything and linger where you like/skip where you don't.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: totaljoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a top location in kurfurstendam. It is next door to the u bahn as well as a host of restaurants. The hotel itself was very clean and the rooms were huge. It was lovely. Our room had a walk-in wardrobe which was a nice touch. There were a few little disappointments about the room though. The first is that staying in Germany in July meant that the weather was sunny and as a consequence the room was very warm. For a hotel if its calibre I think there should have been air conditioning. The second flaw was that the shower covered more of the wall with water than myself which meant I had to hold it throughout. But these two points are minor overall since the hotel was great and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the est hotel we have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: malcolm1973
Reviews.Content: Booked late and got a superb deal. Room was amazing. Bed was almost too big , lost the missus for a while. So clean comfortable and just really relaxing with desk, changing room, sofa, lovely bathroom. Staff were polite and some even friendly, chatted with the owner. A few steps from the main street in the central area and just an unforgettable experience even before we set foot in one of the truly great citys. .

Reviews.Title: “outstanding in every aspect! excellent freindly service, spacious room, clean & comfortable, affordable”
Reviews.Author: riele
Reviews.Content: the hotel is truly a gem - the location is very central & one can easily walk to many major attractions - public transportation is within a block The staff were all helpful, friendly and well informed. Our room was very spacious, very clean and included a seating and kitchen area. Unlike other properties we looked at the internet was readily available at no cost. I would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly stay there when I return to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kizxy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and the hotel exceeded my expectations. Bedrooms were larger than I expected and very clean, loads of towels and all fresh every day. Breakfast was very nice, everything you would expect of a Continental Breakfast and also eggs cooked to order, bacon and sausages, very good. The Hotel was in an excellent position with restaurants and bars in the area. My tip for a nice bar, turn left out of the hotel walk under the train bridge and on the left hand side are a few bars/restaurants. We liked the last bar on the right (near traffic lights), nice atmosphere and very reasonably priced for a drink. Reception staff very helpful and gave us some great advice on local travel! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend Heckers!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: fulhambob
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, lovely (central'ish) location. Tidy, spacious room (we had the 'double comfort') with walk-in wardrobe, all the usual trimmings. However, there is no air-conditioning so if the weather is hot, as it was when we stayed last week, you need to keep the window/s open. And the street outside is really quite noisy, throughout the night. And please, pease, please when I ask for a 'double' room, give me a double bed, not two singles pushed together. Smart place though, extremely helpful staff, and a newspaper every morning, albeit in German which I don't speak.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: WeeMilliesMum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, staff lovely, food great. Central location, no complaints. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “small, quiet hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: traveluvBerkeley
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great area for shopping and dining. It is just off busy Kurfürstendamm, where the big department stores are and where most sightseeing buses stop, and also just a few pleasant blocks from the charming shops and cafes at Savignyplatz and its S-Bahn station. A friend stayed in an original room, and it was smaller than the newer ones, but decor is contemporary and bathrooms up to date throughout. Our very quiet Bauhaus Suite had two balconies, black-and-white-striped curtains and bedcover, light wood floors, walk-in closet with sliding barn-style glass doors, and two TVs—one in the white marble bath, complete with a remote to use while relaxing in the long, deep tub. A wonderful breakfast buffet is available each morning, but unfortunately it isn't included with all bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: FangirlBritta
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hecker's Hotel and the location was great. Only a 2 minute walk to the U-bahn right on the Kurfürstendamm. The shopping around the hotel is fantastic on the Ku'damm and there's plenty of restaurants nearby. If you walk down the Ku'damm for about 10 minutes you walk right up to the Gedächtniskirche which is free to tour. I suggest getting to know the U-bahn your first day and it will get you everywhere you want to go and maximize your time so you aren't spending your whole day walking. The breakfast buffet was great. It included juices, coffee, bacon, eggs, sausages, cold meats, cheeses, yogurts, lots of bread choices, you can even make hand squeezed orange juice. One day it was raining and the hotel offered us free umbrellas. We used the business center to print and scan documents and the staff was very helpful. The service is great. Right across the street is a Sheckler's store. We stopped in here (closes at 7pm) to buy inexpensive bottle of wine, snacks, and toiletries. Much cheaper than using your hotel minibar. Rooms are large and internet was free!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location, rooms need updated - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KearaI
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the hotel. The location was close to public transportation, restaurants, and shopping. Our room was very clean, and had a great updated bathroom. It was huge, as well. However, the furnishings looked like they were about 10 years old. So if you care about appearances, it may bother you, but we thought it was just fine. The best part of the hotel was the service, and the hotel employees went above and beyond when we were having trouble connecting to their free wireless. Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: revitalIsrael
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the hotel. Large spacious room, close to railway stations, very courteous staff, rich breakfast is served until 11 am exactly what is needed when you're on vacation. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “OK, great location!”
Reviews.Author: VenlaJ
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in April 2008 at Hecker´s hotel. I thinkt that hotel was nice, good and big bathroom. Location was really great, especially for shopping! There was also a u-bahn station near the hotel and many good restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Lost my wallet and Heckers were wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Miers_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thought this hotel was wonderful even before I had my wallet stolen from my back pocket( I know! I know!) on the U Bahn. The staff were young and very professional and the Manager was clearly very competent.The rooms were clean and large and everything worked.The facilities were first rate and modern.There was a breakfast dining room but for dinner there seemed to be an arrangement with the restarant next door. However we were not so keen on this place. The location was right next to the Kufurstendam and its elegant shops. We took our evening meals in the cafes and restaurants along this strip. When my cards and cash were stolen the Manager and staff could not have been more helpful. They assured us that our occupancy was not affected even though I had to cancel the credit card which I had given to pay on checkout. They provided telephone and translation help to obtain emergency cards and cash. All this with goodwill and cheerfulness. Everything about this hotel is class and professionalism. Heckers Hotel? Marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: harry58Uk
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in an economy double room. The booking in process was swift and the reception staff were keen to explain local attractions and gave us a free map of our location in relation to them etc. The hotel looked very cool and modern in reception, which is directly next to the bar. The lifts were good and took us to our room on the third floor. The rooms really are massive, much bigger than more expensive hotels we've stayed in. The bathrooms are nice and you get a few toiletries including mouthwash. The walk in wardrobe is good and spacious, it also contained the minibar and a large sink. Our room was at the front of the hotel and we had read reviews of a lot of noise from the streets. It was a bit warm (no a/c) so we left the windows open. There wasnt a great deal of noise and certainly not enough to disturb you. Our stay was mid-week although the bar across the street was still open until quite late so maybe it would be worse on a weekend. The room was cleaned, sheets changed and generally tidied every day which was good. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of one of the most famous shopping areas and close to all public transport. We didnt even use this but just bought an all day ticket for one of the sightseeing busses (20euro) . The sightseeing busses all stop near to the hotel so it shows that you are staying in one of the interesting areas. We didnt really use the hotels own facilities. We had a look at the roof terrace which seemed nice and you could order drinks from the bar on a phone up there and they would be brought to you. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel but it looked quite good when we saw it on. We never saw anyone at all in the bar other than for breakfast but then we didnt spend a lot of time at the hotel. Overall i would say its an excellent place to stay but i think the full rate as quoted on the price boards in the rooms (290euro per night) would be far too expensive for what you get. The discounted rate we got from the internet made it an absolute bargain though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ftrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and enjoyed our stay. I had booked an upgrade as this visit to Berlin was a birthday gift to my husband. The bathroom was big and the room was ok. We smelled smoke in the room when we checked in. As non-smokers we asked for a change but they could only change us 2 days later so we never bothered. As a tip - they have smoking and non-smoking rooms, so arrange when you book! Although the breakfast layout looked small, it was actually excellent ( we have sampled a lot of hotel buffet breakfasts) and you could freshly juice your own oranges. Hotel staff were helpful for directions, buses, trains, etc and went out of their way to find out about trains for our departure day. There were repair works going on so in the end we took a taxi to Scoenfield Airport - about 35 Euros. Berlin was brilliant, a lovely city with loads to see, you couldn't see all you wanted and we plan to go back. The location of this hotel was good. It was in a nice area with plenty of cafes and restaurants and it was near stations and buses.We had brilliant weather and it was nice to wander round near this hotel.The only thing we missed was a terrace at the front of the hotel to sit out at night for a coffee or drink . I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice rooms, lovely adjoining restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: flynn1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend on a Christmas Market trip. The hotel was easy to get to from the Shoenfeld airport, we just took the overground train and simply had a two minute walk from the station to the hotel (get the special weekend travel pass, it is fantastic value and Berlin travel services are the best). The hotel room was very nice. The staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast each morning was very good. The adjoining Italian restaurant is well worth a visit, we had a super meal on our first night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: az-france
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for four nights in the Heckers hotel. The location is excellent, the area is enjoyable to explore with its many shops, galleries and restaurants. It is also convenient to public transportation, the bus and U. The best is the staff, the reception couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. They recommended restaurants, made reservations, helped with directions etc. There is also a very good restaurant at the hotel - we had a very fresh sole one day for lunch. The rooms are a modern design, very comfortable beds, wonderful bathrooms, of marble and highest quality fixtures. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not in city center, but close to train.”
Reviews.Author: bpm5515
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our three week tour of Germany, Austria, and Czech Republic. The hotel is in Rick Steve's tourgide. It is in West Berlin right off a main shopping and dining street. The hotel has parking in the rear. The hotel is modern and clean. The staff was freindly. Our room was large with king bed, walk in closet, a little air lock that provides two doors to the hall which helped with noise. We did not realize that there was no air conditioning but we arrived late on a cool evening after a long drive from Munich. We asked for dining reccommendations at the desk as Rick says there are plenty of resturants at a square by the S-Ban station, however the desk clerk said we should not go in that direction. We were all over Germany and never felt un-safe but we were more concerned in Berlin, probably because it was our first time there and the way American's think about "Berlin". We opted to leave the hotel and go right to a main street with several resturants. Some resturants were closing and after being in Germany for a least a week we were getting tired of pork and potatoes. We found a little Chinese resturant back an alley way off the main street. It was called "Hole in the Wall" in Chinese. Food was great, don't order an entree for each person unless you are really hungry. It was late and the staff sat down and ate at a large table in the rear towards closing. It looked like a family operation. We were glad to see they did not order pizza delivery!.

Reviews.Title: “just like the brochure”
Reviews.Author: Lisdar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel excellent location,turn right 30 yards to the Ku dammstrasse turn left to a lovely leafly square full of great restaurants,and bars,close to railway station and around the corner to Berlin Zoo Lovely large room nicely decorated but with no air condition we colud leave the windows open due to us being to rear of hotel which was quiet would have liked tea/coffe making facilities but no major problem as it has a restaurant which we highly recommend overall would stay here again as the location and quality says it all

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CamillaLinköping
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very large rooms, nice bathroom and a walk-in closet! The furniture is however dated but that is just a minor problem since the overall impression is very good. I loved the breakfast, the wonderful staff and the location - 1 min walk to the big shoppingstreets. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “worlds comfiest bed!”
Reviews.Author: c_and_c_inmanchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Year (silvester) in2004/2005 with my fiancee. We'll always remember Hckers for the amazingly comfortable bed. It was large and so comfy. The room was pristinely clean and the walls seemed to be totally sound proof which is always good in a hotel. The curtains totally blacked out any light from the window which meant not waking earlier than intended, a great thing for new years day. The bathroom was a gorgeous Italian style marble tiled one with a great shower and tv. The breakfast, as far as I remember was decent and we used the restaurant once, which was nice but pricey (I've had better for the same kind of price, although it was good food). Good spot in a great city. Would definitely stay here next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bestauntieml
Reviews.Content: I cant say anything bad about Hecker's, the rooms are huge, the staff very friendly and the restaurant is wonderfull. My room had a huge bathroom, as well as a dressing room with stove and fridge which was a pleasant surprise, I wouldnt stay anywhere else in Berlin, this hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: john_rita
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The rooms are large and airy, with modern clean bathroom and separate dressing room. The service was excellent, the staff friendly and helpful and the breakfast, although expensive, was exceptional with caviar and smoked salmon among a great variety. The adjoining restaurant offers a good menu and is stylish and relaxing. The hotel is in a great position for all the main tourist sites, as well as some of the best shopping in Europe. Overall I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great loved the hotel, nice big room clean modern and great location”
Reviews.Author: aidanh
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, clean modern. The location is excellent, very close to the U ban and the S ban. There are great restaurants nearby. Whern we were there the weather was hot 35C and the air conditining was great. The rooms were huge with modern bathrooms and a seperate walk in closet for clothes and luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and correct services”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian S
Reviews.Content: I've stay a nice weekend in Berlin. This hotel is well located, just by u-ground station and in centre of Ku'damm, the nice boulevard of Berlin. Rooms are correct, large and adecuate. The reception desk is small,and the breakfast room is "open", but breakfast itself is excelent. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch.”
Reviews.Author: heh3d
Reviews.Content: This seems like a lovely hotel, although I wouldn't know. I researched my stay on trip advisor before traveling, and decided that this is where I wanted to stay in Berlin. Combined with a decent price from hotels, I sprung for the deal. When I arrived, I was told that due to a problem with the internet (whatever that means) my reservation had arrived too late, and they were over booked. I had made my reservations over a month in advance and found out on my arrival, so this didn't make too much sense: but what was I going to do. I was taken to their sister hotel, the Domus Hotel which semi-decent, and did not ruin my trip, but the Domus is something like 2 and a half star hotel, instead of the 4 star Heckers that I was expecting. The Heckers staff were sympathetic, but offered no compensation and it really seems like this whole thing should never have happened. The moral of this story, is either to avoid the Heckers, or to avoid hotels; or at least the combination of the two, as good things have not resulted for me. That aside, it appears from the outside to be quite nice, if perhaps a bit too trendy for its own good.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart”
Reviews.Author: Crabbus
Reviews.Content: SO conveniently located and quiet and friendly, I hesitate to tell too many people how great this place is. Skip the breakfast; it's not worth the 15 euros, especially with so many bakeries and coffee shops and patisseries all around.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: DavidMurr
Reviews.Content: Hecker's has a wonderful location: a quiet street, a hundred yards off the Ku'damm, within easy walking distance of the Kaiser Wilhelm Gedaechtniskirche, Zoo Station, KaDeWe, the U-bahn and lots more. The hotel itself is well appointed, the staff friendly and helpful, the rooms spacious and comfortable (ideal for a longish stay--in our case, two weeks) and the breakfast buffet the best we had in Germany. All told, the ideal hotel for a Berlin holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Heckers Hotel is situated on a quiet side street just off Kurfurstendam within two minutes walk of the S-Bahn and numerous and varied restaurants and bars. We stayed here for four days in July 2002 - the spotlessly clean room was the biggest I have ever stayed in, complete with a walk in dressing room with safe and minibar, good marble bathroom and comfortable bed. Staff were polite and unobtrusive. Buffet breakfast was enormous. Some hotel websites can be misleading but "what you see is what you get" at this hotel web site - a modern, comfortable and stylish hotel in one of the best locations in the city.

HotelInfo.Name: Hecker's Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Grolmanstrasse 35, 10623 Berlin, Germany
